news_header: Hurricane Milton has weakened to a Category 2 storm as it approaches Florida, where resident Jukka Palonen is prepared and staying home with his family.
news_text: Hurricane Milton struck Florida early Thursday morning (Finnish time) and has weakened to a Category 2 storm. Jukka Palonen, who lives in Tampa with his family, plans to stay home despite the approaching storm. He has made preparations, including installing hurricane-resistant doors and windows, and securing a generator for power. Palonen owns a large seven-hectare property with multiple buildings and has moved all loose items indoors. He reports heavy rainfall and anticipates wind speeds of 45-50 meters per second as the storm approaches. His property is not in a flood zone, and he expresses that he won't be able to sleep until the storm passes.
